title: Plotting biology
text: order manage right skew caused older groundfish, ages binned certain age percentile. argument cutoff can used specify age percentile graph start binning (automatically set 0.95). may also choose set by_sex TRUE want differentiate sex.
code: age_frequency(data = all_data,                subregions = c("PBS", "NWFSC", "AK BSAI", "AK GULF"),                species = "arrowtooth flounder")

title: Plotting biology
text: following function generates length frequency plot. want instead see histogram lengths year may choose set time_series argument FALSE (although must subset all_data desired regions calling function).
code: length_frequency(data = all_data,                   subregions = c("PBS", "NWFSC", "AK BSAI", "AK GULF"),                   species = "arrowtooth flounder") length_frequency(data = nwfsc_bio,                   subregions = "NWFSC",                   species = "arrowtooth flounder",                  time_series = FALSE) #> Warning: Removed 1 row containing non-finite outside the scale range #> (`stat_bin()`).

title: Plotting biology
text: also function provides mean length time differentiated sex.
code: length_ts(data = all_data,            subregions = c("PBS", "NWFSC", "AK BSAI", "AK GULF"),            species = "arrowtooth flounder")

title: Plotting biology
text: next function plots histogram heatmap age-depth relationship. Sex differentiation by_sex works best just looking one region, although looking across regions also option.
code: plot_age_depth(data = all_data,                 subregion = c("AK BSAI", "AK GULF", "PBS", "NWFSC"),                 species = "arrowtooth flounder") plot_age_depth(data = all_data,                subregion = "NWFSC",                 species = "arrowtooth flounder",                by_sex = TRUE)

title: Plotting biology
text: can make types graphs length-depth relationship well. , by_sex argument can specified .
code: plot_length_depth(data = all_data,                   subregions = "NWFSC",                   species = "sablefish")

title: Plotting biology
text: make growth plots, function internally uses prediction data formulated von Bertalanffy function stored fishyplots package. function takes biological data, desired region(s), 1 species. argument facet_all automatically include subregions regardless missing data, can turned set FALSE.
code: data(vb_predictions) plot_growth(data = all_data,             subregions = c("AK BSAI", "AK GULF", "NWFSC", "PBS"),             species = "arrowtooth flounder")

title: Plotting biology
text: Finally, can also plot length-weight relationship. Similat growth function, function internally uses log-log regression prediction data fishyplots package. argument subset defaults TRUE plot random subset 10000 points per region quicker plotting speed. see available data points, set FALSE.
code: data(lw_predictions) length_weight(data = all_data,               species = "arrowtooth flounder",               subset = TRUE) #> Note: Plotting a random n = 10000 subset of arrowtooth flounder. Model values not impacted.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Zoe Khan. Author, maintainer. Callie Murakami. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Khan Z, Murakami C (2025). fishyplots: Plotting Utilities Coastwide Synopsis. R package version 0.1.1.
code: @Manual{,   title = {fishyplots: Plotting Utilities For Coastwide Synopsis},   author = {Zoe Khan and Callie Murakami},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.1}, }

title: Plotting Utilities For Coastwide Synopsis
text: repository collection plotting functions used coastwide synopsis project, led Zoe Khan Callie Murakami.  functions code heavily inspired Fisheries Oceans Canada’s reports Anderson SC, Dunic JC, Keppel EA, Edwards . 2023. data synopsis British Columbia groundfish : 2023 data update. Canadian technical report fisheries aquatic sciences, 1488-5379 ; 3641. Anderson, SC, Keppel, EA, Edwards, . 2021. data synopsis British Columbia groundfish: 2021 data update. DFO Can. Sci. Advis. Sec. Res. Doc. 2022/020. vii + 257 p. associated code https://github.com/pbs-assess/gfplot work also building initial NOAA versions (summer 2024) synopsis idea Chantel Wetzel https://github.com/DFO-NOAA-Pacific/gfsynopsis-noaa Matt Callahan https://github.com/MattCallahan-NOAA/gapproductssynopsis Installation:
code: devtools::install_github("DFO-NOAA-Pacific/fishyplots")

title: Function and formatted data to plot design based index — plot_dbi
text: species common scientific name species interest. See examples options per dataset. surveys surveys survey group, required specify servey/region plotted. See examples options per dataset.

title: Function and formatted data to plot design based index — plot_dbi
text: ggplot object, plot design based indicies

title: Function and formatted data to plot design based index — plot_dbi
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # To see options for species and surveys in regions: "NWFSC", "AFSC", "PBS" data(all_dbi)  all_dbi %>% filter(region == "AFSC") %>%  distinct(common_name)  all_dbi %>% filter(region == "AFSC") %>% distinct(survey)    # usage examples plot_dbi("sablefish", "U.S. West Coast") plot_dbi("dover sole", "U.S. Gulf of Alaska") plot_dbi("arrowtooth flounder", "SYN QCS") } # }
